quizDescription: Solve these easy crime riddles and sharpen your detective skills!

questions.question: I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
questions.explanation: Pencil graphite is mined, encased in wood, and used by many people to write or draw.

questions.question: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
questions.explanation: An echo 'speaks' when it reflects sound, and it seems to 'come alive' with the wind carrying sound waves.

questions.question: I am not alive, but I can grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
questions.explanation: Fire can 'grow' by spreading, 'breathe' by consuming oxygen, and be extinguished by water.

questions.question: I have keys but open no locks, I have space but no room, you can enter, but you can't go inside. What am I?
questions.explanation: A keyboard has keys for typing, but they don't open locks. It has space between keys, but you can't go inside it.

questions.question: I am a word of letters three, add two, and fewer there will be. What am I?
questions.explanation: The word 'few' has three letters. When you add two letters ('er'), you get 'fewer,' which means a smaller quantity.
